private_information: You are one of two manipulators in this BlocksWorld scenario.
You are responsible primarily for executing or proposing the odd-numbered actions in the provided sequence.
You can move only the top block of any stack and carry only one block at a time.
mover1.goal: Follow the public action sequence assigned to you and report the actions you will execute in the specified notation.

private_information: You are one of two manipulators in this BlocksWorld scenario.
You are responsible primarily for executing or proposing the even-numbered actions in the provided sequence.
You can move only the top block of any stack and carry only one block at a time.
mover2.goal: Follow the public action sequence assigned to you and report the actions you will execute in the specified notation.

private_information: You coordinate the information received from mover1 and mover2 and produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' action sequences, compute the final blocks arrangement, and emit a PDDL domain and problem description that encodes the initial state and the derived final arrangement for FastDownward.

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks present: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Initial arrangement: A is on H, H is on G, G is on the table; B is on the table, J is on B, F is on J, C is on F; D is on the table, I is on D, E is on I.
Equivalently initial stacks (bottom to top): G - H - A ; B - J - F - C ; D - I - E.
An ordered sequence of 20 actions is executed in the environment as follows:
All agents share this public information. Agents may have private assignments of which steps they perform.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert BlocksWorld operator. Do not emit PDDL. Based on the public information and your private information, provide the sequence of actions you will execute. Use the notation unstack(X,Y) and stack(X,Y). Provide the actions as a numbered list in a single-line string (no newlines). Focus on the odd-numbered steps assigned to you and confirm they are legal given the public initial arrangement.
plan.prompt: Your name is mover1. You see the public information about the blocks and the full action sequence. You are primarily responsible for the odd-numbered actions in that sequence. State exactly which of the odd-numbered actions you will execute and confirm legality with the current visible state when each action is performed. If you need to refer to a block position, reference the public initial arrangement and the effect of earlier actions you or the other mover executed. Produce only the numbered list of actions you will perform in the given notation.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert BlocksWorld operator. Do not emit PDDL. Based on the public information and your private information, provide the sequence of actions you will execute. Use the notation unstack(X,Y) and stack(X,Y). Provide the actions as a numbered list in a single-line string (no newlines). Focus on the even-numbered steps assigned to you and confirm they are legal given the public initial arrangement.
plan.prompt: Your name is mover2. You see the public information about the blocks and the full action sequence. You are primarily responsible for the even-numbered actions in that sequence. State exactly which of the even-numbered actions you will execute and confirm legality with the current visible state when each action is performed. If you need to refer to a block position, reference the public initial arrangement and the effect of earlier actions you or the other mover executed. Produce only the numbered list of actions you will perform in the given notation.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent BlocksWorld and with PDDL oriented for the FastDownward planner. Your job is to integrate the action sequences provided by the agents, compute the final arrangement of all blocks after applying the actions in order, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions or responsibilities from the two agents identifiable, but the resulting PDDL must model the single-world state transitions and the final goal equal to the derived final arrangement.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the action sequences from mover1 and mover2. Integrate them, verify legality step by step against the public initial arrangement and BlocksWorld rules, compute the final placement of every block, and then produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair targeted for the FastDownward solver that captures the BlocksWorld rules, the initial state, and the final arrangement as the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If any ambiguity arises from the agent sequences, resolve it by following the action order provided in the public information. The domain should include predicates for on, ontable, clear, holding, and handempty, and actions such as unstack and stack. The problem must define objects A through J, the initial facts derived from the initial arrangement, and goals corresponding to the final arrangement you computed.
